questions.text: Marge calls in to which radio station in the beginning of the episode?
questions.explanation:
K-BBL.

	In the beginning of the episode, the family sits down for breakfast and Lisa and Bart fight over the last doughnut (which Homer eats).  The kids are nearly late for school and leave behind the special lunches that Marge made for them (instead opting to steal money from her purse for lunch).  Homer is late for work and rushes off leaving Maggie asleep in her high chair and Marge listening to K-BBL on the radio.

questions.text: Which doctor does Marge talk to on the radio?
questions.explanation:
Dr. Marvin Munroe

	After calling the radio hotline (555-PAIN), Marge decides to vent out her anger and stress on the local psychologist who just happens to work on the show.  Homer happens to be listening to the radio at work and realizes that his wife is worried about their relationship.  Dr. Munroe advises her to tell it to him straight at the front door when he arrives home and he decides to make things right again.

questions.text: What type of flower does Homer buy for Marge at the flower shop?
questions.explanation:
A rose.

	After heading to the bar, Homer is told (by Moe) to treat Marge to a fancy dinner and a night at a nice hotel in order to make her feel like she should.  Homer immediately heads to the flower shop and buys her a longstem rose before heading home where an angry Marge stands waiting by the door, even refusing to give the kids food.

questions.text: At which motel does Homer reserve a room for Marge's special night?
questions.explanation:
The Offramp Inn.

	After showing up at the door with chocolate and a rose, Homer professes his love for Marge and she loses her anger.  He tells her the plans and she quickly decides to call for a babysitter for the occasion.  When she gets a hold of Rubber Baby Buggy Bumper Babysitting Service, they immediately hang up the phone due to their past experiences with the family.

questions.text: What name does Homer use when calling the babysitting service?
questions.explanation:
Sampson.

	In order to prevent the babysitting service from refusing them, Homer decides to pose as Homer 'Sampson' and they immediately send a babysitter.  Meanwhile, Marge and Homer get ready for their big night and Marge comments that Homer dances like an angel.  When the doorbell rings, the kids answer it to find their babysitter, Ms. Botts, standing there.

questions.text: What does Homer eat for dinner at the restaurant during his and Marge's night out?
questions.explanation:
Lobster.

	At the restaurant, Homer tries to select a dead lobster, but the maitre'd suggests that he choose a living lobster as it defeats the purpose of eating live lobster.  Meanwhile, the babysitter forces Bart and Lisa to watch 'The Happy Little Elves' while she puts Maggie to bed.  Although Lisa doesn't mind this, Bart opposes the authority and fights to turn off the film.

questions.text: On which TV show do Bart and Lisa find Ms. Botts' true motives?
questions.explanation:
America's Most Armed and Dangerous.

	Bart changes the movie to "America's Most Armed and Dangerous" on the TV and they view a segment about a thief posing as a babysitter who sneaks into houses through babysitting jobs to steal everything they own.  This babysitter bandit is later revealed to be the Ms. Botts who is babysitting the Simpson kids.  Before they can escape, Ms. Botts appears in the doorway with a rope, ready to tie up the kids.

questions.text: What is the hotline that Lisa attempts to call to alert the authorities about Ms. Botts?
questions.explanation:
1-800-USQUEAL.

	Lisa quickly runs to the kitchen phone and dials the "America's Most Armed and Dangerous" hotline while Bart runs into the basement and hides under the stairs.  Both of them end up tied up in the living room.  Meanwhile, Maggie wakes up in her room and crawls downstairs without being caught.  She manages to save her siblings while watching the end of the "Happy Little Elves" movie.

questions.text: With what does Bart knock out Ms. Botts?
questions.explanation:
A baseball bat.

	After Maggie unties Bart and Lisa, they devise a plan which lures Ms. Botts out of the bedroom and into a darkened area.  Bart hits her over the head with a bat and they tie her up in the living room.  Meanwhile, Marge and Homer have a great night at the Offramp Inn and Marge decides to call home to check on the kids.  When there's no answer, they decide to return home.

questions.text: The babysitter bandit is sent to jail.
questions.explanation:
False.

	In the end, Bart and Lisa make it to a payphone and call "America's Most Armed and Dangerous", but Homer and Marge return home where Homer unties Ms. Botts, sends her on her way with her luggage, and triples her pay.  The kids return home with the cops and news reporters to find that Homer let her get away (though he claims that a massive fight was involved).
